question.text: The correct arrangement of events in the cardiac cycle according to their duration is:

options.text: Atrial systole < Ventricular systole < Ventricular diastole < Atrial diastole
Atrial systole < Ventricular systole < Atrial diastole < Ventricular diastole
Atrial systole < Atrial diastole < Ventricular systole < Ventricular diastole
Ventricular systole < Atrial systole < Ventricular diastole < Atrial diastole

solution.text: The cardiac cycle includes systole and diastole in a cyclic manner. It includes joint diastole, ventricular systole and atrial systole. Duration of the total cardiac cycle is 0.8 sec. The durations are atrial diastole lasts for 0.7 sec. Ventricular diastole is for 0.5 sec. Ventricular diastole for 0.3 sec and ventricular systole for 0.3 and atrial systole for 0.1 sec.
